Model Evaluation

You can evaluate your agent and compare its policy to the fixed adaptive therapy protocols using the evaluate module.

The evaluate module contains the script for the default evaluation configured by the config.yaml file, fixed_at utility function and the Evaluate class.

class physilearning.evaluate.Evaluation(env, config_file='config.yaml')[source]
static plot_trajectory(episode=0)[source]

Plot the trajectory

Parameters:

episode (int) – episode to plot

Return type:

None

run_environment(model_name=' ', num_episodes=1, save_path='./', save_name='model', fixed_therapy=True, fixed_therapy_kwargs=None)[source]

Run the environment on the trained policy.

Parameters:

  • model_name (str) – name of the model to load

  • num_episodes (int) – number of episodes to run

  • save_path (str) – path to save the trajectory

  • save_name (str) – name of the file to save the trajectory

  • fixed_therapy (bool) – if true, run fixed adaptive therapy

  • fixed_therapy_kwargs (Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) – keyword arguments for fixed adaptive therapy

Return type:

None

save_trajectory(save_name)[source]

Save the trajectory to a csv file or numpy file

param: save_name: name of the file to save the trajectory

Return type:

None

physilearning.evaluate.fixed_at(obs, environment, threshold=0.5, at_type='fixed')[source]

Cycling adaptive therapy strategy, applies treatment only if the tumor burden is above a threshold

Parameters:

  • obs (ndarray) – observation from the environment

  • environment (LvEnv) – environment

  • threshold (float) – threshold for the tumor burden

  • at_type (str) – type of adaptive therapy strategy

Return type:

int

Returns:

action

physilearning.evaluate.evaluate()[source]

Evaluate the trained model based on the evaluation specs in the config file

Return type:

None

Note

Fixed adaptive therapy may not work as expected with image observations.
